result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee Edward Bennett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$1,900.00 to Eddie L.  Joint and several with codefendant in 15CF760.  
Restitution to Bouchard's to be determined at a later date.  Joint and several  with coactor(s) to be named.
Pay restitution, DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements from monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of defendant's prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
**Must have no contact with and be kept separate from codefendant Phillip Lee.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Eddie L.
No contact with Bouchards at 7600 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled sustances or alcohol.
AODA assessment, tretment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously taken and on file.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee Edward Bennett Jr

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant regarding restitution.
Original Transcript (42 pages) commencing 07/29/2015  GUILTY PLEA/ SEMTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Two (2) Victim Impact Statements with attached resitution worksheets received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for resitution hearing. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Arguments heard as to restitution. Discussion regarding the read-in charges in this matter. Court denied State's request for resitution. Court took no further action.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was passed to the afternoon calendar. As defendant was getting ready to be brought into court, defense counsel advised the State and the court that his client is not prepared to plead guilty and wants a trial date.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Any motions to be filed, movant has until 7/06/15; response due by 7/16/15; reply due by 7/20/15.  All motions in limine, witness lists and jury instructions must be filed prior to the next date.  Motions to be heard on date of trial; court will keep negotiations open.  Jury trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requested another date; needs an offer and to determine whether defendant has been compliant with sex offender registry.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's request to have 14CF5619 added to Branch 20's calendar for global resolution was granted.  Branch 38 notified of same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant revoked and now in Dodge; has an open sex offender case in Branch 38.  Defense counsel requseted another date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
April 23, 2015 @ 8:30A in BR 20, SB Rm 113 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Lee Edward Bennett not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Case is continued before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
PRELIMINARY HEARING Transcript commencing FEBRUARY 27, 2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF760 (15 Pages).kl

Defendant Lee Edward Bennett in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Lee Edward Bennett in custody.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the address of "4700 North Hopkins Street."  Sworn for the state:John Kohler-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case has been reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Phillip Lee or 4702 N. Hopkins Street.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lee Edward Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Lee Edward Bennett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
